settings.html: Unlock the Power of Sea Moss: 92 Minerals in Just 2 Spoons!

settings.heading: Miracle of the Sea
settings.description: Long ago a Sea Moss is a unique natural storehouse of vitamins and components necessary for a healthy body. It contains 92 active components which have favorably influenced the immune system of the human body. It provides a wide range of positive influences from boosting energy and improving digestion to promoting healthy skin and supporting thyroid function.

settings.heading: Some more details about the main components:
settings.description:
Vitamin C - an antioxidant that supports the immune system and helps the body absorb iron.

Vitamin B2 - is important for energy production and the metabolism of fats, proteins, and carbohydrates.

Iron - is important for the immune system, energy metabolism, supporting brain function and development.

Magnesium - regulating nerves and muscle function, also maintaining healthy bones and regulating blood pressure and blood sugar level.

Zinc - plays a role in immune function and helps to fight off infections and diseases.

settings.heading: Hand made from real wildcrafted sea moss
settings.description: We take pride in our commitment to using only the finest ingredients in our sea moss gel. That's why we exclusively use 100% authentic wildcrafted sea moss, carefully sourced from the pristine waters of St. Lucia in the Caribbean. This small island is renowned for producing the highest quality sea moss available, ensuring that our customers receive the full benefits and nutrients of this powerful superfood. With our sea moss gel, you can rest assured that you're getting the best possible product for your health and well-being.

settings.heading: Easy how-to-use instructions:
settings.description:
• To ensure the freshness and quality of our sea moss gel, we recommend storing it in the refrigerator as soon as you receive it.
  • The recommended daily amount is 1-2 tablespoons. 
  • You can enjoy our sea moss gel by itself or mix it with your favorite beverages and foods. It's a versatile ingredient that blends well with smoothies, teas, juices, and even coffee. 

Feel free to make up your own receipts and share it with us on our social media :)

settings.title: What is Sea Moss?
settings.text: Sea Moss is a type of seaweed/algae believed to boost your immune health by helping prevent and relieve cold and flu-like symptoms. It is found on the Atlantic coastlines of North America/Europe, and the Carribean Islands. Irish Sea Μοss has been used for generations in places like Ireland, Scotland, and Jamaica in food and healing remedies. Sea Moss is most commonly known for its anti-inflammatory, anti-aging, anti-bacterial, and anti-viral properties.

settings.title: What are the benefits of Sea Moss?
settings.text:
• Contains 92 of the 102 essential minerals that are body are composed of
  • Supports a Healthy Heart
  • Promotes Good Digestion, Soothes Digestive Tract
  • Helps Maintain a Healthy Weight
  • Is a great Post Workout Recovery Tonic
  • Promotes a Healthy Thyroid
  • Strengthens and Supports a Healthy Immune System
  • Improves and Boost Metabolism
  • Supports Healthy Hair, Skin and Nails (Nourishes and Beautifies them)
  • Relief from Flu Symptoms and Coughs
  • Removes Toxins and Heavy Metals
  • Strengthens Joints and Connective Tissue
  • Promotes Increased Energy and Nutrition
  • Supports the Oxygenation of Cells
  • Improves Nutrient Absorption
  • Anti-Inflammatory, Reduces Inflammation
  • Helps Eliminate Excessive Mucus
  • Suppresses Appetite and Provides Key Nutrients During Fasting
  • Protects Brain from Degeneration
  • Support Reproductive Health
  • Helps people suffering from Malnutrition
  • Helps fight against Radiation Poisoning
  • Increases Libido
  • Assists in Regulating Diabetes
  • Regulates High Blood Pressure
  • Anti-Cancerous, Aids in recovering from Cancer
  • Assists in the Treatment of COPD, such as Bronchitis
  • Aids in fighting Respiratory Infections, such as sore throats
  • Anti-Viral
  • Contains Zinc (helps the immune system fight of bacteria and also helps wounds heal more quickly)
  • Is a Prebiotic, which is a type of dietary fiber that’s essentially fertilizer for probiotics (healthy bacteria in your gut), and thus, helps further support digestion.
  • Contains Folate (essential for prenatal health and development)
  • Rich in Sulfur, which is known to lower levels of microorganisms on the skin and soothe inflammation
  • Contains vitamins and minerals like magnesium, Vitamin A, C, D, E, F, K, B12, B1, & B2
  • Contains Omega-3 Fatty Acids, which help to hydrate and promote healthy skin cell function
  • Contains a compound called Citrulline-Arginine, which facilitates cell growth.
  • Rich in collagen for healthier skin, hair, and nails.

settings.title: Are there any downsides to Sea Moss?
settings.text: Yes, overconsumption. Autoimmune thyroid conditions can come into play, such as Hashimoto's, which is a disease in which the immune system mistakenly attacks the thyroid gland. Hypothyroidism is one of the most common problems.

settings.benefit_subtitle: Sea moss acts as a prebiotic, providing important nutrients such as dietary fiber, mucilage, potassium, magnesium, calcium, carrageenan, and agar.

Sea moss contains omega 3 fatty acids, which play a crucial role in improving brain health and cognition function. Adequate levels of iodine is essential for optimal brain function and cognitive development.
Sea moss is beneficial for immunity with the help of vitamin C, zinc, selenium, and its other nutrients. The immune system is closely connected with gut health, so a balanced microbiome is essential.
Iodine is a vitamin needed for proper thyroid function, which produces hormones that regulate metabolism.  Adequate levels of iodine is essential for optimal brain function and cognitive development.
Sea moss is a natural source of iron, which is involved in energy production. B vitamins also play a crucial role, helping to prevent mind fog and lethargy.
Sea Moss provides hydration and collagen support thanks to carrageenan, both of which are essential for these parts of the body.
Calcium, magnesium, zinc, manganese, selenium, and collagen provide great support for bone health.
Sea moss is naturally rich in potassium chloride, which is known for its ability to dissolve phlegm and mucus, making it easier to expel.

settings.benefits_sub_title: BRAIN • ENERGY • DIGESTION • SKIN • HAIR • IMMUNITY • EASY BREATH • FOCUS

settings.title: Iron
settings.content:
Sea moss is a natural source of iron, which is the key mineral involved in oxygen transport and energy production.

Sufficient iron levels can help prevent the early iron-deficiency anemia, a condition characterized by fatigue and low energy levels.

settings.title: Iodine
settings.content: Sea moss is a natural source of iodine, which is important for thyroid function. The thyroid gland is an important thing, producing hormones that regulate metabolism, including brain metabolism. Adequate iodine levels are essential for optimal brain function and cognitive development.

settings.title: Magnesium
settings.content: Magnesium is the big boss when it comes to muscle contraction and relaxation because it supports healthy muscle function and reduces muscle cramps and spasms. It multitasks by also optimizing energy production and improving the nervous system, preventing such things as anxiety and PA.

settings.title: Dietary fiber
settings.content: Sea moss is a rich source of dietary fiber, which is very important for maintaining healthy digestion, regulating bowel movements, and supporting gut health.

settings.title: Sulfur
settings.content: Sulfur is an essential mineral that supports the production of keratin, a protein key to healthy skin, nails, and hair. It helps strengthen the hair and nails and contributes to clear and healthy skin.

settings.title: Mucilage
settings.content: Sea moss contains mucilage, a gel-like substance that forms when it comes into contact with water. Mucilage has a soothing effect on the digestive tract, helping to alleviate irritation and inflammation in conditions like gastritis, ulcers, and acid reflux.

settings.title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
settings.content: Sea moss contains omega-3 fatty acids, which are known for their cardiac benefits and potential support for brain health and inflammation management.

settings.title: Zinc
settings.content: Zinc is involved in the production of new skin cells, helping to maintain the integrity of the skin and nails. It is also involved in the synthesis of proteins and DNA, which is important for hair growth and strength.

settings.title: Calcium
settings.content: Sea moss is a good source of calcium, a mineral essential for building and maintaining strong bones. Calcium is a crucial component of bone structure and helps support bone density and strength.

settings.title: Full Ingredients
settings.content: Calcium, Iron, Phosphorus, Riboflavin, Zinc, Niacin, Magnesium, Copper, Folate, Manganese, Vitamin C, Vitamin A, Vitamin B6, Vitamin K, Vitamin E

settings.title: How Long Do You Need To Use Sea Moss To Feel Its  Effects?
settings.text: Consistency is key when it comes to reaping the benefits of sea moss, just like with other health-boosting practices such as sports, yoga, and meditation. When you make sea moss a part of your daily routine, thus filling in any nutritional gaps, you'll start noticing tangible changes and improvements in your overall health within two months*

settings.question: Where is our sea moss from?
settings.answer:
We are proud to say that our sea moss is sourced from a Marine-Protected Area off the coast of Nha Trang Bay, Vietnam - one of the most pristine and coveted bays in the world. Our local team collects the sea moss in the wild and dries it under the sun right on the shore, ensuring the highest quality and sustainability.

We take the safety and quality of our product seriously, and that's why we have all the necessary documents from our supplier, including the certificate of origin, Phytosanitary certificate, and Certificate of Analysis. Furthermore, our products have been checked by the FDA at customs to ensure they meet the highest standards.

settings.question: What if you have serious diseases?
settings.answer: At the moment, no negative side effects of sea moss have been identified. However, in case of any diseases, we advise you to contact your GP for an initial consultation regarding the intake of sea moss.

settings.question: How do you use sea moss gel?
settings.answer: You can easily add our True Sea Moss gel into your routine with just eat 2 tablespoons a day after the meal. You can also cook it however you like, such as adding it in smoothies, desserts, or juices.

settings.question: How could I use sea moss for my skin?
settings.answer:
We recommend a wildcrafted gel, which contains no fruit, for application to the skin. However, we believe that taking sea moss orally greatly accelerates the process of skin regeneration and the reduction of all imperfections. The main benefit of sea moss is that taking it orally has a beneficial effect on the whole body, not just the skin.

If you want to take sea moss both orally and topically, we advise you to take 2 jars: a wildcrafted one and one with any flavor.

settings.question: Why our gels?
settings.answer:
Our True Sea Moss team strives every day to do their best to create a product that we, our family, and our customers will love more and more.

We are careful about our ingredients, as there is not a single added sugar in our sea moss gels. It's only delicious because of the fruit grown on natural farms, some of which are in California.
We're tired of "out of stock" and "slow shipping", so you'll receive your purchase in as little as 2 days.

settings.question: Can I use sea moss while breastfeeding or being pregnant?
settings.answer: We do not recommend sea moss for breastfeeding and pregnant women without consulting first with your healthcare provider. This is a particularly delicate, so it is best to ask a professional about activities that may affect the health of you and the baby.
